節錄（唔想睇原文既可以睇呢度）：
...In the MTR we strive to maintain the temperature at or below 26°C in train compartments throughout the year...
...Except on very hot days, the temperature in the concourse is pre-set by the environmental control system at or below 29°C, and on the platforms at or below 27°C...

原文：
Dear Mr XXXXXXXX

Thank you for your online feedback commenting on the air-conditioning and ventilation in the Tung Chung Line and Tsuen Wan Line trains, and the temperature levels in Central, Wai Chai and Lai King Stations.

First of all, we would like to apologise for the unhappiness this matter is causing you.

In the MTR we strive to maintain the temperature at or below 26°C in train compartments throughout the year. As you may probably be aware automatic air-conditioning and ventilation systems are in place to maintain the optimal air-flow and temperature. Furthermore, in order to provide a comfortable travelling environment for our passengers, the air-conditioning temperature in stations and trains is controlled in such a way as to be progressive from the outdoor ambient temperature to the train temperature. Except on very hot days, the temperature in the concourse is pre-set by the environmental control system at or below 29°C, and on the platforms at or below 27°C. These temperature settings aim to provide passengers with a progressively comfortable and pleasant travelling environment as they enter the station from the outside environment and before they enter the train.

However, several external factors can affect the actual on-train temperature from compartment to compartment, such as the number of passengers on board and the opening and closing times of train doors in stations. The in-train air-conditioning is designed in such a way that the condensed air is automatically delivered evenly throughout the train compartments without manual control or adjustments being made. If the compartment temperature drops below the pre-set range, then the on-board temperature sensors will cut off the generation of chilled air from the air-conditioner. Meanwhile, the ventilation system will continue to provide air circulation, including fresh air, inside the train compartment.

For your information, a large-scale chiller replacement programme (the system that controls the air-conditioning in stations) will be implemented in 38 MTR stations (including Wan Chai and Lai King Stations) on seven railway lines (Tsuen Wan Line, Kwun Tong Line, Island Line, Tseung Kwan O Line, East Rail Line, West Rail Line and Tung Chung Line) and four railway depots later this year. Starting from the fourth quarter of 2017, a total of 160 chillers will be replaced with more advanced and environmentally friendly systems by 2023. For detailed information, you may refer to the following link : http://www.mtr.com.hk/archive/corporate/en/press_release/PR-16-041-E.pdf

Nevertheless, we will continue to monitor the temperature level in all areas of the stations and trains to ensure that a comfortable travelling environment and a good air quality in the stations and trains is maintained wherever possible for passengers at all times and that this is supported by routine checking and maintenance work. Thank you for your feedback and for taking the time to write to us.

Yours sincerely
WXXXXXXXXXX CXXXXXXXXX
Public Relations Manager – Customer Care MTR Corporation
